data.title: delete and editing file
data.body:
hi,

when im having a file open,
i deleted the file from the tree pane,
but somehow forgotten about it and editted the same file
when i close the tab, it does not warn me of the file is missing or the file has changed.
it closed without any warning or confirmation.

its my mistake, but i think atom should consider checking if the file is been deleted and the content have changed. otherwise, deleting the file should prompt that the content is changed but u r trying to delete the file, if yes, it should close the tab to avoid further confusion.

thank you

data.title: Add more file extensions on OS X
data.body:
Carried over from #9449. Currently Atom's `file` icon gets used for these file extensions: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/resources/mac/atom-Info.plist

Would be good to add at least all the languages that come bundled with Atom: https://github.com/atom/language-examples/tree/master/languages

I think these are missing:
- `clojure`
- `COMMIT_EDITMSG`
- `less`
- `mk`
- `mustache`
- `erb`
- `scss` + `sass`
- `toml`

![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 11 07 26 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/11081983/b9f5052c-8864-11e5-83b4-cce677e3779c.png)

data.title: TypeError when using custom test runner with atom package
data.body:
I'm on atom 1.2.0-beta2 and I'm trying to use a custom test runner.  My `package.json` has

```
{
"atomTestRunner": "./lib/main"
}
```

and `lib/main.js` has

```
module.exports = function () {
  console.log('Hi');
};
```

Finally I have a spec file `spec/main-spec.js` which has a single log statement:

```
console.log('Bye');
```

When I run `atom-beta --test spec/main-spec.js` I get this output:

```
$ atom-beta --test spec/main-spec.js
Hi
TypeError: Cannot read property 'then' of undefined
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/initialize-test-window.js:76:14)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/initialize-test-window.js:88:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:190:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at setupWindow (file:///Applications/Atom%20Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/static/index.js:79:5)
    at window.onload (file:///Applications/Atom%20Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/static/index.js:35:9)
```

Is there a workaround for this error?  It's also very possible I'm doing something wrong.  Please advise!

When editing remote file date modified doesn't update

Hi,

As the title says when I edit remote files (windows share) the date modified doesn't change to reflect that the file has been modified.

I am using Atom V1.1.0 on windows 10 and the shared drive belongs to a windows 2012 server.

This effects all remote files but local files are behaving as would be expected.

I have tried to re-create the error with notepad and other IDE's but they have all updated the date modified.

The menu begins to populate a list of packages so I know that it is making the necessary connections to pull the information needed.

data.title: Faster settings load
data.body:
When activating a package, we load its settings asynchronously. Then, as soon as Node is done with IO, it calls us back with the content of those files, at which point we call `ScopedProperties::activate` to transfer those settings into our `Config` instance.

When setting a key in our `Config`, we emit an event that notifies attached listeners that something has just changed: the implications of this are pretty important, as there is a remarkable amount of operations we need to do in order to notify those clients, such as comparing the newly set key with the previous one, etc. Although the current implementation could be somewhat improved in terms of performance, it handles the configuration semantics pretty smartly, which means that, whenever setting something in the configuration, it's better to emit as little events as possible. For this reason, before the changes introduced with this PR, we were [wrapping packages activation with a call to `Config::transact`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/46665c1f8b86664f9431d66cfd9e291bdc0689cf/src/package-manager.coffee#L419-L423).

The problem with this approach, however, is that it doesn't play well with the asynchronous nature of loading the configuration, as the transaction will end as soon as we've finished iterating over the packages to activate (i.e. _before_ `ScopedProperties::activate` has the chance to execute). This means we emit way more events than we really should, paying an extra amount of time during startup:

![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/11060723/54d06bae-87a2-11e5-9749-9103bcd74e67.png)

The breakdown here is the following:
- Parsing CSON: `~ 39.2ms`
- Activating Grammars: `~ 71.0ms`
- Activating Settings: `122.4ms` + `37.9ms`
- **Total: 294.9ms**

For this reason, we have introduced a `Config::beginTransaction` and `Config::endTransaction`, which are aimed to handle the asynchronous scenario in a more performant manner:

![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/11060724/551a89b4-87a2-11e5-9a4d-43c11afed1a6.png)

We can observe a a `~ 125ms` speedup, as this approach allows us to emit just a minimal amount of events, thereby dramatically reducing the overhead of loading setting files.

For the future, I think it's also worth taking a look at how we might improve CSON (which, for bundled packages, is actually JSON) parsing and grammars activation, in order to reduce those remaining `169.7ms` to the minimum.

/cc: @atom/feedback @nathansobo @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: Use lazy loaded snippets
data.body:
Ref.: https://github.com/atom/snippets/pull/182

Ref.: https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-snippets/pull/60

data.title: High latency loading network mapped files
data.body:
I have a remote server with samba server installed. I shared one directory on the server and mapped the dir to my local windows machine.
When I tried to add the directory as project folder into Atom, it took a very long time to load the first level dirs and files.
I also tried to load the remote dir into sublime, the loading is pretty fast. 
Do you guys have any idea about this? I prefer Atom better, but the latency is not bearable for me.

Environments:
OS: Windows 7 64bit ultimate
lastest Atom Text Editor

Thanks.

data.title: getBeginningOf(Next|Previous)ParagraphBufferPosition doesn't work with CRLF line endings
data.body:
`getBeginningOfNextParagraphBufferPosition` and `getBeginningOfPreviousParagraphBufferPosition` in [cursor.coffee](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/cursor.coffee) do not work if the line endings are CRLF. For example, when using vim-mode, paragraph jumping does not work (see atom/vim-mode#911).

I spent a good deal of time trying to fix this problem, but I don't have a good solution. The current regex, `/^\n*$/g`, does not work as Javascript regex counts CRLF as two line breaks ([source](http://www.regular-expressions.info/anchors.html)), so the regex matches to the second half of a CRLF pair. I experimented with some other regex patterns but have been unable to find one that works.

I also considered getting CRLF/LF information from elsewhere and using that to pick a regex pattern to use. I tried `@editor.buffer.prefferedLineEnding`, but that is unreliable, as it needs to be set explicitly or it is undefined. 

Another option, which I haven't tried implementing, is to simply use the line ending of the current line to pick the regex, however I am not sure if this would be considered acceptable behavior. If this seems reasonable I'd be happy to implement it and PR. If there are other ideas, I'd also be happy to implement them.

data.title: Atom autoupdate keeping gigabytes of redundant copies of Atom
data.body:
This keeps happening after I leave Atom running for a while:
![screen shot 2015-11-10 at 11 22 25 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/682772/11050798/5e86af64-879d-11e5-8ffa-6492eafe08fb.png)
Every single one of those folders contains an _identical_ v1.10 Atom.app. This is using a significant amount of download quota and totally filling my small SSD - that listing represents almost 9 GB! At startup, Atom deletes all the folders and the cycle continues.

data.title: Change version number scheme for built versions
data.body: So that version numbers sort in a more expected way, we should change the version numbers of built versions from `vX.Y.Z-dev-SHA` to `vX.Y.Z-alpha-SHA`.

data.title: Add channel indicator to title bar
data.body:
Currently the title bar has the following information:

```
<filename> - <path> - Atom
```

When running Beta or Alpha (custom-built) channels, there should be an indication of this in the title bar:

```
<filename> - <path> - Atom[ Alpha|Beta]
```

data.title: Horizontal Scolling From Trackpad Treated Like Arrow Keys
data.body:
When I use Horizontal Scrolling from my touchpad, Atom treats it like I am just pushing my left/right arrow keys, moving the cursor one character at a time left or right. Vertical Scrolling works great for me from my touchpad.

Behavior does not change with toggling the following settings:
- Scroll Past End
- Soft Wrap
- Soft Wrap At Preferred Line Length

OS: Windows 10 (this was happening on Windows 8.1 as well)
Atom Version: 1.1.0
Computer: Samsung ATIV Book 8
Touchpad: Elan Touchpad (ETDWare X64 15.7.0.1_WHQL)

data.title: Atom auto update doesn't work for unprivileged users on OSX
data.body:
When using Atom from an unprivileged user account and there is an update available I can see that Atom downloads it and then asks to install an update. The popup that shows up asks for my password, but since this is an unprivileged account that doesn't work. What happens in this case is that I enter the password, click on the button to install and nothing happens. I go to the Atom menu where there's now the "Restart and update" option which I choose.

After clicking on the mentioned menu option Atom closes and doesn't reopen again. Ever. I waited. After restarting it manually I'm still on the old version and Atom is again trying to download the update.

If I try to enter the computer's admin username and password in the popup mentioned above, the behavior is exactly the same as described.

If I try to update when logged in with the admin account, it works perfectly fine.

This is with OSX 10.9.5 and Atom 1.0.19.

data.title: linux x64 (debian 8.2) atom crashed when opening file
data.body:
linux x64 (debian 8.2) atom crashed when opening file 
below is the output:
~$ atom -df --safe
[10363:1109/134414:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(173)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
[10363:1109/134415:ERROR:nss_util.cc(819)] After loading Root Certs, loaded==false: NSS error code: -8018
[10363:1109/134415:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[10363:1109/134415:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[10363:1109/134415:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[10363:1109/134415:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[10394:1109/134415:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started
App load time: 433ms
[10394:1109/134415:ERROR:nss_util.cc(819)] After loading Root Certs, loaded==false: NSS error code: -8018
[10363:1109/134416:INFO:CONSOLE(119)] "Enabled theme 'monokai' is not installed.", source: /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js (119)
[10363:1109/134416:INFO:CONSOLE(46)] "Window load time: 1341ms", source: file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (46)
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: 
[10363:1109/134453:ERROR:channel.cc(300)] RawChannel read error (connection broken)

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'hiddenInputComponent' of null
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 1.1.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'hiddenInputComponent' of null

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-element.js:221

TypeError: Cannot read property 'hiddenInputComponent' of null
  at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.blurred (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-element.js:221:51)

```
